messages.subject: explaining UNschooling ...
messages.msgSnippet: that s what I do, too ... I just say we re *eclectic* ... goodness, it s just NOT worth the energy to *splain* myself to people who really don t get it ... why
messages.messageBody:
that's what I do, too ... I just say we're *eclectic* ... goodness, it's
just NOT worth the energy to *splain* myself to people who really don't get
it ... why waste the extra energy ... course, IF THEY DO want to know,
that's a whole other story, I'll be GLAD to talk their arm off ...

Pris ~> who lacks patience sometimes ...

WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...

----- Original Message -----
From: <marbleface@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, September 07, 2000 6:17 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 777



>
> In a message dated 09/07/2000 4:00:02 AM !!!First Boot!!!,
MorelFam@...
> writes:
>
> glad to know i am not the only one. i guess it is natural to be wary in
a
> society that is so school oriented, etc. >>
>
>
> Oh, I never actually tell people we are UNschooling. They just wouldn't
get
> it. Not in the time I have to spend explaining, anyway. Most people seem
> content with "no, we don't really use a set curriculum (that's ALWAYS
their
> first question), we do a combination of things."
>
>
> Nance
